    "question_text": "Analyze the key social, economic, and political factors that led to the outbreak of the French Revolution. Discuss how these factors created the conditions for revolutionary change.",
    "model_answer": "The French Revolution was sparked by a confluence of factors, including:\n\nSocial factors:\n- Widespread poverty and inequality among the lower classes, with the peasantry and urban poor facing high taxes and food shortages\n- Resentment towards the privileges and extravagance of the nobility and clergy\n\nEconomic factors: \n- Financial troubles of the French government, including high debt from involvement in the American Revolution\n- Crop failures and famines that exacerbated food shortages and economic hardship\n\nPolitical factors:\n- Absolutist rule of King Louis XVI, who resisted calls for democratic reforms and representative government\n- Influence of Enlightenment ideas about individual rights and the social contract\n\nThese factors created deep resentment and a desire for radical change among the French people, leading to the outbreak of the revolution in 1789.",
